intro: Guatteria kamakusensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian guatteria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Hawaii. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are berries that mature to a dark red color, containing several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Guatteria kamakusensis is considered a rare and endangered species.
